message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.NE 

This paper discusses the use of data augmentation in improving model robustness, which is a common topic in machine learning (cs.LG) and computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also analyzes the margin that data augmentation enforces on empirical risk minimizers, which is a concept in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and cryptography (cs.CR). Additionally, the paper presents lower bounds on the number of augmented data points required for non-zero margin, which is a mathematical concept that is relevant to neural networks (cs.NE).
